As we approach the 100th anniversary of the attempt at secession, a notable surge
of public interest in the war between the states is in evidence. The purpose of
this series is to give a ’’report1* on the major battles of the Civil War as seen
by a specific Michigan regiment* In the series the South is treated sympathetically5
nevertheless, the primary point of view is Northern, and the focus of attention is
placed on Northern troops.
The material for the series is taken directly from official records, regimental
histories, and Adjutant Generals’s reports. The consultant is E. E* Barthell,
author of the Civil War section in the Encyclopedia Britannica.
Although great stress is placed on the role of Michigan troops in the war, it was
felt that the series would be of general interest in many other areas of the
country. Nowhere is the impression given to the impartial listener that Michigan
won the war without assistance.
Since this series is based on rigid research, and since the topic of the series
is of great interest in many parts of the country, this series is offered as a
bonus series.
